page.title: 05FARMS IN CLIFTON HAMPDEN
page.content:
The main feature of the farms is that they are becoming large complexes rather than remaining small family concerns.
Due to changing ownership of long established farms, few old village families are now employed. Workers come from as far away as Reading, although many do live locally or on the farms themselves. Mechanization and intensive farming have in any case reduced the number of jobs available. Four appears to be an average number of employees with two or three more taken on as casual labour at harvest time. Many ex-farm workers have found employment in the car factories at Cowley.
